TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Click on each apparatus/reagents to know its name or click on “Continue” to start the experiment.
50 g soil is weighed using an electronic balance.
Place a butter paper above the balance and Tare the balance.
Using a spatula take some into the butter paper.
Using a spatula take some soil into the butter paper and weigh 50 g soil.
Take the butter paper containing soil.
Transfer the soil into a clean 500 ml Kjeldahl flask.
Place a butter paper and tare the balance.
Using spatula take some CuSO₄.Transfer the CuSO₄ into the butter baper and weigh 1g.
Take the butter paper containing CuSO₄.
And transfer that into Kjeldahl flask containing soil.
Using spatula take some K₂SO₄.Transfer the K₂SO₄into the butter paper and weigh 10g.
K₂SO₄bottle is kept back.
Take the butter paper containing K₂SO₄.
And transfer it into Kjeldahl flask.
Shake the flask to mix it well.
Shake the flask to mix it well.
And keep it back.
Add 30 mL con. H₂SO₄.
Add 30 mL con. H₂SO₄.
Frothing appears.
notext
Shake the contents of the flask to mix.
Shake the contents of the flask to mix.
After thorough mixing allow to stand for at least 30 minutes with frequent shaking.
After thorough mixing allow to stand for at least 30 minutes with frequent shaking.
After 30 minutes take the Kjeldahl flask.
Clamp it on an iron stand in a fume hood (Don't allow to touch the flask in Electric Bunsen).
notext
Place a butter paper into the balance and Tare.
Using a spatula Take some CuSO₄.Transfer it in to the butter paper and weigh 1g CuSO₄using electronic balance.
Take the butter paper containing CuSO₄.
Transfer it into a clean 500 ml Kjeldahl Flask.
Place a butter paper into the balance and Tare.
Take K₂SO₄.Using a spatula take some K₂SO₄.Transfer some K₂SO₄ into the butter paper.Weigh 10 g K₂SO₄ using electronic balance.
Take the butter paper containing K₂SO₄.
Transfer it into Kjeldahl flask.
notext
Shake the flask to mix it well.
And keep it back.
Add 30 mL con. H₂SO₄.
Add 30 mL con. H₂SO₄.
Frothing appears.
notext
Shake the contents of the flask to mix.
Shake the contents of the flask to mix.
notext
After thorough mixing allow to stand for at least 30 minutes with frequent shaking.After 30 minutes Take the Kjeldahl flask.
Clamp it in an iron stand in a fume hood (Don't allow to touch the flask in Electric Bunsen).
Switch on the both Electric Bunsens.
Digest for about 2 hrs. Digestion is effected on the Kjeldahl digestion rack with low flame for the first 10-30 min until the frothing stops.

Until the frothing stops and then gradually more strongly until the sample is completely charred. The heat is gradually raised until the acid reaches approximately one third the way up the digestion-flask.
After 2 hrs Switch off both bunsens.
Remove the Bunsen. Wait for 30 minutes.
After cooling first take the Kjeldahl flask which is labelled as SAMPLE from the fume hood.
notext
Take a wash bottle containing distilled water.
Measure 100 ml of water.
Measure 100 ml of water.
And transfer the water into the flask.
notext
Swirl the flask about 2 minutes.
Transfer the fluid part to a 1000 ml RB flask.
notext
Wash the residue left in the Kjeldahl flask with 4 or 5 lots of 50–60 mL distilled water.
Wash the residue left in the Kjeldahl flask with 4 or 5 lots of 50–60 mL distilled water.
Measure 50 mL water.
And transfer the water into the flask.
notext
Decant the washing into the RB flask.Repeat it two or three times.
notext
Add a few, glass bead to prevent bumping and take the RB flask.
Place the RB flask in a heating mantle.
To the one neck connect the dropping funnel.
To the other neck connect the Kjeldahl Trap.
Connect a dropping funnel.
Connect a Kjeldhal trap.Place an iron stand. The trap is connected to the condenser with a delivery tube.Attach one rubber tube to the inlet of the condenser.
Take a 250 ml conical flask and to that conical flask add 25ml 0.1 N HCl.
Take a 250 ml conical flask and to that conical flask add 25ml 0.1 N HCl.
notext
Take methyl red indicator using a dropper.
And to the 25 mL 0.1 N HCl add two drops of methyl red indicator.
Take the conical flask.Properly place it below the condenser.
Measure 125 ml 40 % NaOH solution using a clean measuring jar.
Measure 125 ml 40 % NaOH solution using a clean measuring jar.
notext
Transfer the NaOH solution to the dropping funnel.
Allow to fall down the 40 % NaOH solution into the RB flask.
notext
Switch on and adjust the temperature of the heating mantle.
Allow the ammonia formed to be absorbed in the HCl in conical flask.
notext
Take wash bottle containing distilled water.
Wash down the end of the tube using distilled water into the conical flask.
Take a red litmus paper.
Using a wash bottle wet the litmus paper.
Show the wet red litmus paper in the mouth of the delivery tube, Absence of colour change shows no more ammonia is received.
Stop the distillation.
Take a clean burette.
notext
Take 0.1 N NaOH.
Fill the burette with 0.1 N NaOH.
notext
Clamp the burette on stand.
Take the conical flask from the distillation assembly.
Place it below the burette.

Titrate the excess of the acid with 0.1 N NaOH solution. Titrate till the pink colour changes to yellow, Note the titre value and from the titre value calculate the multi equivalence of the acid participating in the process of ammonia absorbing during digestion.
notext
Take the Kjeldahl flask containing BLANK solution from the fume hood.
notext
Take distilled water.
Measure 100ml distilled water using a clean measuring jar.
Measure 100ml distilled water using a clean measuring jar.
Transfer that into the Kjeldahl flask.
Swirl the flask about 2 minutes.
Swirl the flask about 2 minutes.
Transfer the fluid part to a 1000 ml RB flask.
notext
Wash the residue left in Kjeldahl flask with 50-60ml distilled water.
Measure 50 ml distilled water.
Measure 50 ml distilled water.
Transfer the water into flask.
Swirl the flask about 2 minutes.
Swirl the flask about 2 minutes.
Decant the washings into the RB flask, Repeat it two or three times.
notext
Add a few, glass bead to prevent bumping and take the RB flask.
Place the RB flask in a heating mantle.
Fit the RB flask with two neck joint.
To the one neck, connect a dropping funnel.
To the other neck, connect a Kjeldhal trap.
Place an iron stand. The trap is connected to the condenser with a delivery tube.Attach one rubber tube to the inlet of the condenser. Attach another rubber tube to the outlet of the condenser.
Take a 250 ml conical flask and to that conical flask add 25ml 0.1 N HCl.
Take a 250 ml conical flask and to that conical flask add 25ml 0.1 N HCl.
notext
Take methyl red indicator using a dropper.
And to the 25 mL 0.1 N HCl add two drops of methyl red indicator.
Take the conical flask. Properly place it below the condenser.
Measure 125 ml 40 % NaOH solution using a clean measuring jar.
Measure 125 ml 40 % NaOH solution using a clean measuring jar.
Transfer the NaOH solution to the dropping funnel.
Transfer the NaOH solution to the dropping funnel.
notext
Switch on and adjust the temperature of the heating mantle.
Allow the ammonia formed to be absorbed in the HCl in conical flask.
notext
Take wash bottle containing distilled water.
Wash down the end of the tube using distilled water into the conical flask.
Take a red litmus paper.
Using a wash bottle wet the litmus paper.
Show the wet red litmus paper in the mouth of the delivery tube, Absence of colour change shows no more ammonia is received.
Stop the distillation.
Take a clean burette.
notext
Take 0.1 N NaOH.
Fill the burette with 0.1 N NaOH.
notext
Clamp the burette on stand.
Take the conical flask from the distillation assembly.
Place it below the burette.

Titrate the excess of the acid with 0.1 N NaOH solution. Titrate till the pink colour changes to yellow, Note the titre value and from the titre value calculate the multi equivalence of the acid participating in the process of ammonia absorbing during digestion.
